column4: hello i was using g4l to reimage my machine and when i completed and rebooted it claims the system is missing operating system, i boot back into g4l and check fdisk, shows that the right partition is the boot partition (marked with *) and I mounted the partitions and it shows that everything is correct....  how can I get the system to boot? anything else i can try to do?
it might be as simple as repairing grub - see !grub
sure - but you need to have the liveCD (or similar)
if you are using fedora core, you should really be in #fedora (or whatever it is) -- but yes, you can use the ubuntu live CD
